title: Graphing

title: Choose a method
text: Note that either Wash and Shell method works in this case. Since it will be more convenient to set up a rectangle that is parallel to the y-axis and run it over the x-axis, we proceed to use Shell Method to calculate the volume.
speech: Note that either Wash and Shell method works in this case. Since it will be more convenient to set up a rectangle that is parallel to the y-axis and run it over the x-axis, we proceed to use Shell Method to calculate the volume.
pacedSpeech: Note that either Wash and Shell method works in this case. Since it will be more convenient to set up a rectangle that is parallel to the y-axis and run it over the x-axis, we proceed to use Shell Method to calculate the volume.

title: Shell Method
text: The general formula of cylindrical shells is given as $$2*pi*\int_{a}^{b} x f{\left(x\right)} \,dx$$.
speech: The general formula of cylindrical shells is given as  2 times p i times the integral from a to b of x f of x d x .
pacedSpeech: The general formula of cylindrical shells is given as   2 times p i times the integral from a to b of x f of x d x

title: Define a lower limit
text: What is a lower limit of the integral?

subHints.title: A point of intersection
subHints.text: The lower limit is also the point where two graphs intersect each other. To find that point, we set $$y^2=y^2-2y+1$$ and solve for $$x$$. Then $$x=\frac{1}{4}$$

speech: What is a lower limit of the integral?
pacedSpeech: What is a lower limit of the integral?

title: Define an upper limit
text: The upper limit is already given as $$x=2$$.
speech: The upper limit is already given as  x is equal to 2 .
pacedSpeech: The upper limit is already given as   x is equal to 2

title: Define f(x)
text: What is the f(x) of the integral?

subHints.title: Define f(x)
subHints.text: Since we are working on the change over the x-axis or dx, we will need to rewrite both functions in term of $$x$$ instead of $$y$$ as given.

subHints.title: $$x=y^2$$
subHints.text: To solve for $$y$$, we take the square root of both sides to obtain $$y=\sqrt{x}$$ and $$y=-\sqrt{x}$$. Although we have $$2$$ solutions, we only consider the positive solution since it is the upper function of the shaded region.

subHints.title: $$x=y^2-2y+1$$
subHints.text: Recall that $$y^2-2y+1={\left(y-1\right)}^2$$ then $$y-1=-\sqrt{x}$$. After solving for $$y$$, we have $$y=1-\sqrt{x}$$. Again in this case we chose $$-\sqrt{x}$$ as an answer to use because it is the lower function of the shaded region.

speech: What is the f(x) of the integral?
pacedSpeech: What is the f(x) of the integral?

title: Find f(x)
speech: the square root of x minus 1 minus the square root of x is equal to, 2 the square root of x minus 1
pacedSpeech: the square root of x minus 1 minus the square root of x is equal to, 2 the square root of x minus 1

title: Set up the integral
speech: 2 times p i times the integral from 1 fourth to 2 of x parentheses, 2 the square root of x minus 1  times d x
